entry.title: Like You Were My Closest Friend
entry.summary:
Author: isthatacatsherlock

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,558Chapters: 1/?Kudos: 0

Summary: Helena did not know that Buck took care of him after he got shot. She certainly didn’t know that he stayed with Chris until he came home from the hospital. She didn’t know what a natural move it was for Buck to take over his lease because he already fit so nicely into his life. She wouldn’t always say anything, but when she did they were just little comments she could tell had some deeper resentment under them.“Sounds like he helped with Chris a lot,” she said one morning over coffee.“It wasn’t like a big deal or anything,” said Chris. Helena was looking at Eddie when she responded “mhm.”It would be impossible to get her to understand, but he needed him here. In theory the choice to move had been easy. Not a choice at all – Chris, above all else. That was true. Buck didn’t just matter, though. He was entwined.

entry.title: The Wild Boy
entry.summary:
Author: Warlock_Nerd

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 14,718Chapters: 16/28Kudos: 444

Summary: The 118 get a call to some nearby woodlands where the police are waiting for their assistance. Athena tells them that they need to help with a little boy that had gotten his leg stuck in a beartrap. All seems simple but then she tells them that the boy is a feral child, animalistic and frightened, and was throwing rocks at people who tried to get closer. Buck and Eddie are tasked to get him to safety.The boy is scared of everything around him, people, sounds, objects, the wind, the smells. Terror is all the boy knew until he found something he wasn’t scared of.And its name was Evan Buckley. :3Warnings - Heavy descriptions of medical trauma, child abuse, neglect and injury.Queue found family, Christopher being an amazing big brother and the 118 being the best family in the entire world. :3

entry.title: pizza down, dick out
entry.summary:
Author: brewrosemilk

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 1,454Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 58

Summary: “You know, some people romance their way into a situation like this.”“Mhm,” Eddie breaks the kiss and leans back, still giving a roll of his hips as he runs a hand through his own damp hair—putting on a show as he raises an eyebrow, completely unbothered. Then he leans forwards again, bracing a hand on the back of the couch, his other warm palm landing on Buck’s heaving chest, gradually sliding downwards. “And some people see a semi and strip so fast they almost choke on their dinner.”

entry.title: Being himself
entry.summary:
Author: Poetryobsessedbi

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 8,531Chapters: 2/?Kudos: 133

Summary: Buck realises that he and Abby will never work out. So as a celebration/solo pity party for himself he goes to the one place that he can completely be himself. It's a small bar, run by his friend justin, that caters to veterans, but especially the ones of the queer variety. When a handsome stranger, who turns out to be a probationary firefighter walks in, it feels like his luck might have turned after all.Or; What if Buck and Eddie met in a bar for queer vets? what if they felt free enough to be themselves, because they knew the other would understand? What if, instead of falling in an instant friendship after the fated grenade in leg, they fell together earlier, in a whole different way? Feat. Buck being a Navy SEAL, Eddie being less repressed, falling in love and finding a family

entry.summary:
Author: Winters_Pheonix

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 37,711Chapters: 6/6Kudos: 134

Summary: Eddie diaz had lost his son six months ago. Just when he thought he had finally figured out a way to get him back, his phone rings in the middle of the night and he leaves to pick up his drunk best friend. One drunken rant later Eddie's heart is once again torn apart because if he chooses one he will loose the other.Now he has to find a way to keep both halves of his heart together while also trying to figure out a part of himself that made itself known after a conversation with an old friend.

entry.title: hearts beat the same in different beds
entry.summary:
Author: mihaly

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 3,242Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 12

Summary: “It was like he was assuming Eddie and I are together. Like, that’s ridiculous, right? He’s just my best friend. Everything I’m doing for him is just what a best friend would do. You’re supposed to care about your best friend, want to do anything for them. Like, I have literally run through fire for Eddie and I’d do it again. There’s nothing I wouldn’t do for him, and it breaks my heart every day that he’s gone, and, and I feel like there’s some piece of me that is missing now that he’s not here. He’s the best person I’ve ever met and—“ “Oh my God, Evan, you’re in love with Eddie!” ---After Eddie moves to Texas, Buck realizes he loves him, and Eddie realizes he's gay. entry.title: truth dare, spin bottles
entry.summary:
Author: MuddieBuddies

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 2,252Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 50

Summary: “What about Spin the Bottle?” He chugged his beer, then slammed it down on the coffee table.“Hmmm, that’s less messy. I’m down,” Ravi nodded.The rest of the group crowded around the couch and seemed to be in agreement.Buck, at first, was repulsed by the idea of kissing one of Ravi’s friends, but maybe it would help him get over Eddie.“Buck, you in?” Ravi asked.Buck chugged his drink. It burned as it slid down his throat.“What the hell, sure.” or; Eddie is gone, so Buck seeks friendship with Ravi. Ravi invites Buck to one of his house parties and a friendly game of spin the bottle takes place. Buck is forced to face his feelings for Eddie head on when the bottle lands on him.
